intro: Dicrypta longifolia, commonly known as the long-leaved crypta, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its slender, branched stems and finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of its family. It thrives in moist, shaded environments, often found in woodland areas. Dicrypta longifolia is known for its delicate appearance and is sometimes cultivated in gardens for its ornamental value.
